incidents.name: Deployments fail to load metadata from docker.io

incident_updates.body:
Deployments that build new images are failing with errors like:

ERROR [internal] load metadata for docker.io...

We're investigating the issue now.

The failed deployments do not impact existing machines and nomad allocs. They only prevent new changes from getting deployed.
This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We're currently investigating an increase in authentication errors
This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.
This incident has been resolved.
We've fixed the problem and are monitoring the results.
We found the problem and are working on a fix.
We're investigating intermittent deployment, dashboard and API access issues.
This incident has been resolved.
This issue has been mitigated, but we're still working on a more permanent fix.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

We have a registry that only keeps storage in the iad region, which we think will work around the issue you are seeing. Try it out with:

FLY_REGISTRY_HOST=registry-iad.fly.io fly deploy

Use this if you are doing docker push directly to the registry:

FLY_REGISTRY_HOST=registry-iad.fly.io fly auth docker
docker push registry-iad.fly.io/torem-app:latest

We are working to fix the core issue. We'll report back once that's done. In the meantime, we hope the above unblocks deployments.
We are continuing to investigate the issue. In the meantime, customers can try deploys using registry2.fly.io.
Some customers may experience an issue deploying workloads due to failed image pulls
Resolving this issue. Continuing to monitor but API and Dashboard should be responsive again now.
Fix deployed. Continuing to monitor.
We continue to investigate the underlying issue. Auth is working but potentially slow/degraded.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.
We are currently investigating an issue with login/authentication to Fly.io on both dashboard and flyctl.

Several application hosts had an issue causing intermittent degraded disk performance from 2023-08-30 18:20 to 2023-08-31 16:30 (UTC). The issue has now been resolved.

App instances on affected hosts may have experienced intermittent interruptions in disk I/O, elevated network latency or request timeouts during this time.

incidents.name: Intermittent issues pulling images from Docker hub

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
Docker hub is having intermittent failures. Tracked at https://www.dockerstatus.com/
This incident has been resolved.
Failed hardware has been removed from cluster and functionality has been restored. We are monitoring for further problems with the service.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.
This incident has been resolved.
The fix has been deployed and we are monitoring for further capacity issues.
We've identified the cause of the issue and are deploying a fix.
We're currently investigating an issue where regions are incorrectly reporting no available capacity.
Connectivity has been restored.
One of our upstream internet providers is experiencing connectivity issues in the JNB region.

Developers trying to create apps or machines, including during deployments, may have encountered â€œno capacity available in <region>" errors today. We deployed a change to flyd at 18:51 UTC and rolled it back at 19:25 UTC. That change included an occasional bug in how we calculate host capacity, which for some developers resulted in the "no capacity available in <region>" errors.

Please retry any deployments or machine creations that failed during this time.
Network has returned to normal operation
Connectivity should be improving. We are monitoring the situation.
There has been a large fiber cut in the JNB region that's affecting connectivity. We are working with our providers to route around the issue.
This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We are continuing to investigate. Use `FLY_REGISTRY_HOST=registry2.fly.io fly deploy` to deploy against our backup registry.
registry.fly.io is returning 500 responses in some cases, which may cause issues with deployments. We're investigating the issue.
This incident has been resolved.

affected_components.name: Application Hosting - JNB - Johannesburg, South Africa

incident_updates.body: Our datacenter provider applied a routing change restoring connectivity for about half of the affected routes. About 10% of cross-region routes to JNB remain degraded.

affected_components.name: Application Hosting - JNB - Johannesburg, South Africa

incident_updates.body: We are seeing partially-degraded network routes in the JNB region again today. The root cause appears to be ongoing network congestion at an upstream Internet backbone provider. Applications hosted in JNB may be experiencing intermittent deploy failures or partial network connectivity issues to other regions.

affected_components.name: Application Hosting - JNB - Johannesburg, South Africa

We are investigating elevated error rates for the registry in the SIN and HKG regions. Application deployments in these regions are affected.
This incident has been resolved.
We are investigating some degraded network routes affecting the MAA region. Applications hosted in MAA may be experiencing intermittent deploy failures or partial network connectivity issues.
This incident has been resolved.

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

affected_components.name: Platform and Tools - SSL/TLS Certificate Provisioning

incident_updates.body: We are currently investigating an outage with the Vault cluster backing TLS certificates. Provisioning new certificates will not work, and our proxy may be unable to serve HTTPS for certain domains in certain regions.

affected_components.name: Platform and Tools - SSL/TLS Certificate Provisioning

incidents.name: We're currently experiencing a high rate of exceptions from our secrets vault and are working to resolve the issue.

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We've identified the issue and removed a faulty node from our secrets cluster. API and Deployments are functioning correctly and we're monitoring for full recovery.
We are currently investigating this issue.

incidents.name: Investigating possible issue with flyctl command line tool (auto-upgrade)

incident_updates.body: A flyctl release was bad. More info: https://community.fly.io/t/quick-fix-for-todays-flyctl-regressions/14277
We are currently investigating a possible issue with flyctl command line tool.

incidents.name: We are undergoing emergency vendor hardware replacement in YYZ region.

incident_updates.body: Incident should be resolved. Will continue to monitor closely.
This incident should be resolved at this point with YYZ region available. Continuing to monitor.
Connectivity is partially restored and we are continuing to monitor.
YYZ region is experiencing an outage currently with vendor undergoing emergency network hardware replacement.
This incident has been resolved.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

incidents.name: Delayed state causing more 502s and connection issues

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
As we've grown, the stress on our state replication infrastructure became too great due to a mis-enforced concurrency limit. We're rolling out a fix to all hosts.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.
We are currently investigating this issue.
This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We are currently investigating an issue that causes logs to stop processing for certain apps.

incidents.name: SIN network issues affected edges and wireguard gateways

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

An outage in SIN from an upstream network provider is causing issues with Wireguard gateways. If you are having trouble deploying or accessing your private network from a Wireguard peer in SIN, you'll likely need to temporarily create a peer in a different region.

Edges are affected as well, but traffic has been re-routed.

Between 14:30-16:15 UTC, a widespread Comcast/Xfinity network outage affected connectivity in several regions including `lax`, `bos`, `ewr`, and `atl`, causing network interruptions to applications and deployments in these regions. The issue seems to have been resolved.

incidents.name: Machines API degraded - returning 504s for a small number of requests

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We are continuing to work on a fix for this issue.
The Machines API (aka flaps) is returning 504 responses for a small number of requests. This may affect a small number of apps v2 deployments. Engineers are working to address the issue.
We have added a new region (BOM - Mumbai, India) to mitigate the capacity issues in MAA. At this time we suggest deploying workloads to BOM instead of MAA.

We are continuing to monitor the situation. 

Due to ongoing capacity constraints in MAA we recommend migrating your workloads to the alternative BOM region.

Your apps in MAA will continue to run, but it is no longer possible to create new Machines in this region.

Due to ongoing capacity constraints in MAA, we have built a new nearby region in BOM and recommend migrating your workloads there.

Your apps in MAA will continue to run, but it is no longer possible to create new Machines in this region.
We are currently working to add more capacity to MAA.
This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been deployed and we are monitoring the results.
We've identified an issue causing app metrics to stop being collected from some Machines that have been created/updated in the last ~24 hours, and we're working on deploying a fix.

incidents.name: registry.fly.io pulls failing from some hosts in iad

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We have investigated an issue with some hosts failing to pull images from registry.fly.io in iad. A quick fix has been implemented and we are continuing to monitor.
This incident has been resolved.

We've rolled back some infrastructure changes that may have allowed the registry to leak connections. Registry errors have returned to normal levels, and deploys are functioning properly in all regions.
The registry is rejecting connections from some hosts in some regions. We're restarting processes, which seems to be helping reduce the error rate.
We are investigating an increased rate of image pull failures in a handful of regions. These are interfering with some customer deploys, and show as a failed VM in `fly status`.
Metrics issues have been resolved.
We've increased the limits for metrics ingestion across the impacted cluster and are monitoring recovery.
Currently investigating problems with metrics ingestion. It looks like querying metrics still works.
This incident has been resolved.
We have noticed consistently high demand in the SJC region and are provisioning additional capacity.
